page.title: 12MINSTERLEY CHURCH
page.content: Minsterley Church was built in {1690}for the{Thynne family}who owned Minsterley Hall.The{stone}was from Caus Castle, but mostly it was built with{bricks}which they bought. It was built to save the Thynne family from going to Westbury every Sunday.They even have their own{path {from the Hall to the Church,&}their own gate in the churchyard wall. It was finished in 1692. The head of the Thynne family is now The{Marquis of {Bath. When my class visited the Church, I saw the sad & faded{maidens' {garlands}& a frightening{carving}by the West door of{cherubs & skulls & {crossbones.}The{screen}has carvings of {sea serpents}on it. It is calm & peaceful in the {churchyard}where yew trees grow among the{graves.
